description: From German Anomaloskop, from Ancient Greek ἀνώμαλος (anṓmalos, “irregular, uneven”) (from Ancient Greek ᾰ̓- (a-, “a-, prefix meaning ‘not’”) + ὁμᾰλός (homalós, “even, level”)) + σκοπέω (skopéō, “to look, to look at; to examine, to inspect”) (from Proto-Indo-European *sḱop, ultimately from *speḱ- (“to see; to look, to observe”)).

entries.meaning: (ophthalmology) An instrument used to test for color blindness by measuring quantitative and qualitative anomalies in color perception.
